level.description: The level (usually affects the speed of the game)

score.description: The amount of points the player has

line.description: The amount of lines the player has cleared

piece.description: The amount of pieces the player has placed

time.description: How much time has passed since the start of the game

fallspeed.description: The speed of the piece's descent, commonly referred to as 'gravity'

entrydelay.description: The amount of time in between piece placements, also known as 'ARE'

next.description: The label for the next piece in the queue

hold.description: The label for the piece in the hold queue

skip.description: The label that indicates that you can discard or skip a piece

secrow.description: The unit label for 'seconds per row'. %1 is the amount of seconds

pause.description: Displays on screen when the game is paused

ready.description: Good options are: 'Get Ready!', 'Are you ready?'

start.description: Displays right after 'ready' at the frame the game begins. It displays on a mode that is not focused on clearing it as fast as possible; a mode focused on surviving or achieving a high score.

go.description: Displays right after 'ready' at the frame the game begins. It displays on a mode that focuses solely on clearing the game as fast as possible, such as sprint; 'race-like' mode.

gameover.description: Displays when the game is finished. It does not connotate winning or losing, just that the game has completed

blockOut.description: Displays as a failure message when the piece cannot spawn due to one already being in the way

lockOut.description: Displays as a failure message when the piece was locked above the skyline/ceiling

topOut.description: Displays as a failure message when the stack is pushed above the maximum limit on the board; for example, a stack higher than 40 lines in guideline results in a top out. Also known as 'garbage out'

timeOut.description: Displays when the time runs out

excellent.description: Displays as a victory message. Any sort of praising line like 'Excellent', 'Awesome', 'Great', 'Good Job' is fine

newRecord.description: Displays when the user beats their previous score or time

returnToMenu.description: Displays next to a button prompt or as a button to return back to the menu while in game

loading.description: Displays under 'READY' while the game loads the assets

realTimeAttack.description: This label is used to describe the 'real time', as in a timer that does NOT freeze during Entry/Line Delay. %1 is the actual time (i.e. 00:02:41)

inGameTime.description: This label is used to describe the 'in game time', as in a timer that FREEZES during Entry/Line Delay. %1 is the actual time (i.e. 00:02:41)

blockOutWarning.description: Flashes at the top of the screen when locking the current piece will cause a failure due to it being in the way of the next piece

blockOutHoldWarning.description: Flashes above the hold queue when pressing the hold button will cause a failure due to there being blocks in the way of the spawn position

lockOutWarning.description: Flashes at the top of the screen when locking the current piece will cause a failure due to it being above the skyline/ceiling

topOutWarning.description: Flashes at the top of the screen when locking the current piece will cause a failure due to the incoming garbage pushing the stack above the highest row

watchOutWarning.description: Used as text to draw the player's attention to something; doesn't have to be a direct translation

coolPace.description: Used primarily to show the user that they're on pace to continue playing in certain arcade modes. Can also be used for clearing

coolTetra.description: Used primarily to show the user that they've done something special in certain arcade modes. Known as 'COOL!!' in Japanese.

regretPace.description: Used to show the user that they are playing too slowly in certain arcade modes. Known as 'REGRET!' in Japanese

pressKeyboardKey.description: As in to press the button on the keyboard

pressControllerButton.description: As in to press the button on the controller

clickAnywhere.description: Indicating to click the mouse anywhere on the screen

tapAnywhere.description: Indicating to tap on the touchscreen anywhere

flashingLights.description: Used to warn the player of flashing lights
